stockmarket.stock

Class AbstractStock

  • java.lang.Object
    • stockmarket.stock.AbstractStock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<AbstractStock>, Stock
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultStock

    @NotThreadSafe
public abstract class AbstractStock
extends java.lang.Object
implements Stock, java.lang.Comparable<AbstractStock>, java.io.Serializable
    An abstract implementation of the Stock interface. This class defines several key elements of the implementation.

    A sole constructor is provided, which sets the stock's symbol as a final value. The symbol will function as the defining value of the stock. The methods hashCode() and equals() have been overriden to use this value to compare instances of this class. In addition, the Comparable interface has been implemented in this class, and it also utilizes the symbol to compare stock instances. Since in real life, two stocks of the same company will have the same symbol, and two stocks of different companies will not, this allows for better comparison of stock instances.

    The getValueMap() method inherited from the Stock interface has been implemented and made final in this class. An additional protected method, getModifiableValueMap(), has also been provided. The implementation of getValueMap() now returns an unmodifiable Map for thread safety reasons. However, subclasses will still need to be able to add various values to the Map. The getModifiableValueMap() method has been provided for the subclasses to use. This method is called by getValueMap(), where the Map it received is wrapped in an unmodifiable Map before being returned to the caller.

    In addition, getModifiableValueMap() should never be made final. It should always be there for additional subclasses in the tree to override and add values to as the need arrises.

    THREAD SAFETY: This abstract class is completely thread safe. However, most of this class's state will be defined by its subclasses. This class cannot make any guarantees about the thread safety of its subclasses, however subclasses CAN count on all implemented methods of this abstract class as being thread safe.

    For the purpose of simplicity, this class has a NotThreadSafe annotation, because programs using it to abstractly manage its implementations should not assume that the implementations are thread safe.

    NOTE ABOUT DOWNLOADERS: StockDownloader implementations may not support every field name listed as a constant here. When designing a subclass of AbstractStock, be aware of which downloader is likely to be used and which fields are accepted by it. Fields that are not supported by the downloader, but are passed to it as a parameter, will likely throw an exception.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Craig
    See Also:
    StockDownloader, Serialized Form

      • setStockDetails

        public abstract void setStockDetails(StockDownloader downloader,
                                     boolean fullDetails)
                              throws InvalidStockException,
                                     java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                     java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Stock
        Download the details of this stock. The values retrieved should be set as fields in this class.

        The boolean fullDetails parameter should be kept constant with the getValueMap() method of this class. That is to say that when this parameter is false, the same subset of fields is used in both of these methods.

        The list of fields to download passed to the StockDownloader object should be based on constant properties the downloader will recognize. The public fields provided here are mean to fulfill this purpose.

        Specified by:
        setStockDetails in interface Stock
        Parameters:
        downloader - the StockDownloader utility to get this stock's values.
        fullDetails - if true, downloads the values for all the stock's fields. If false, only downloads a limited set of values for a "quick-view".
        Throws:
        InvalidStockException - if this stock is not a valid stock on the New York Stock Exchange.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if a connection cannot be made to the web server to download stock details, most likely due to lack of an internet connection.
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs while trying to download and parse the stock details.
        See Also:
        StockDownloader

      • getStockHistory

        public java.util.List<HistoricalQuote> getStockHistory(StockDownloader downloader,
                                                       int months)
                                                throws InvalidStockException,
                                                       java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                                       java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Stock
        Download and get a list of HistoricalQuotes defining the recent history of this stock. Useful for long term analysis of trends and the generation of charts.
        Specified by:
        getStockHistory in interface Stock
        Parameters:
        downloader - the StockDownloader utility to get this stock's values from the internet.
        months - the number of months to get a history for.
        Returns:
        a list of HistoricalQuotes for the period requested.
        Throws:
        InvalidStockException - if this stock is not a valid stock on the New York Stock Exchange.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if a connection cannot be made to the web server to download stock details, most likely due to lack of an internet connection.
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs while trying to download and parse the stock details.
        See Also:
        StockDownloader

      • getModifiableValueMap

        protected abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getModifiableValueMap(boolean fullDetails)
        Returns a modifiable Map of all the values contained in this stock, as opposed to getValueMap() which returns an unmodifiable Map. This method should be the one overriden and configured with the necessary values, as it is invoked when getValueMap is called.

        This method should always ONLY return a modifiable Map, to later be wrapped in an unmodifiable Map. This allows further subclasses to continue to override this method to add additional values to the Map without having to worry about Map immutability.

        Parameters:
        fullDetails - whether or not the Map should contain all the values of this stock.
        Returns:
        a Map of the values of this stock.
        See Also:
        AbstractStock.getValueMap()

      • getValueMap

        public final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getValueMap(boolean fullDetails)
        Get a Map of all the values contained in this stock. A boolean parameter is provided so that the full Map doesn't need to be constructed if all that is needed is a smaller subset of data.

        The fullDetails parameter should be kept constant with the setStockDetails() method of this class. That is to say that when this parameter is false, the same subset of fields is used in both of these methods.

        This final method calls on getModifiableValueMap() and wraps it in an unmodifiable Map before returning it. Subclasses wishing to add to the Map should override that protected method in order to do so, as it will publicly be invoked by this method.

        Specified by:
        getValueMap in interface Stock
        Parameters:
        fullDetails - whether or not the Map should contain all the values of this stock.
        Returns:
        a Map of the values of this stock.
        See Also:
        AbstractStock.getModifiableValueMap()
